intro: Malveopsis copelandii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and open in the morning. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent leaves and a deep root system for water storage. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Malveopsis copelandii is often found in rocky soils and is an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
